title: Get more CONTROL with this keyboard! - ASUS Scope RX
description:
Thanks to ASUS ROG for sponsoring today's video! Buy the Scope RX Gaming Keyboard at https://lmg.gg/C1t57 or on Amazon (PAID LINK) at https://geni.us/qBcP9K or learn more at https://lmg.gg/bknLf

Do you really need a keyboard that has a double-sized CTRL button? ASUS ROG thinks you do with optical key switches and, most importantly, water-resistance with their Scope RX Gaming keyboard.

Buy ASUS ROG Keris Gaming Mouse on Amazon (PAID LINK) at https://geni.us/c61m

Buy ASUS ROG PG259QN 360hz Gaming Monitor
On Amazon (PAID LINK): https://geni.us/i5eK8
On Newegg (PAID LINK): https://geni.us/DBjexh
On B&H (PAID LINK): https://geni.us/mI3h12T

Check out the Maingear Turbo Gaming PC we used at https://lmg.gg/f0DHk

Purchases made through some store links may provide some compensation to Linus Media Group.

0:00 - ASUS ROG makes a bold claim

2:24 - Typing test

7:08 - Outro

So this is a linear switch, which means there's no tactile bump, and what that means is that there is nothing to feel whatsoever, it is completely smooth. And whether you prefer that or not, totally down to personal preference. Not actually my thing, but a lot of gamers do prefer these Red-style switches. As for the actuation point, it's about 1.5 millimeters, but you can see it's actually kinda hard for me to find that point because, to prevent accidental keystrokes, they've actually got a 55-gram actuation force, but it takes 40 grams just to start moving it in the first place, to make so that when you've got that really light responsiveness on it, you're not going to just accidentally press them by brushing over them or anything along those lines. One clear benefit to ASUS' RX ROG Red switches here is that you've got really clear illumination. So I suspect once we light this thing up, you can see the LED is right under the legend. So that's a benefit. Nice, bright RGB backlighting.
